tool.name: plotDEXSeq
tool.description: Visualization of the per gene DEXSeq results
tool.version_command: echo $(R --version | grep version | grep -v GNU)", DEXSeq version" $(R --vanilla --slave -e "library(DEXSeq); cat(sessionInfo()\$otherPkgs\$DEXSeq\$Version)" 2> /dev/null | grep -v -i "WARNING: ")" (depends on DESeq2 "$(R --vanilla --slave -e "library(DESeq2); cat(sessionInfo()\$otherPkgs\$DESeq2\$Version)" 2> /dev/null | grep -v -i "WARNING: ")")"

param.name: rdata
param.label: DEXSeqResults object
param.help: A DEXSeqResults object in RDS format. This can be output from the DEXSeq tool

param.name: primaryfactor
param.label: Specify the primary factor name in the DEXSeqResults object
param.help: Only letters, numbers and underscores will be retained in this field

param.name: genes_select
param.label: Genes to plot
param.help: Select to input a single gene ID or a list of IDs. Default: single gene ID

param.name: genefile
param.label: List of gene IDs
param.help: This should be a single tabular column with one gene per row and no header.

param.name: transcripts
param.label: Display transcripts
param.help: If Yes, the transcripts are displayed in the plot. Default: No

param.name: names
param.label: Display transcript names
param.help: If Yes, the names of the transcripts are shown. Default: No

param.name: normcounts
param.label: Plot count values from the individual samples
param.help: If yes, provides a plot of the counts normalized by the size factors. Default: No

param.name: splicing
param.label: Plot exon usage
param.help: If yes, the samples gene expression effects are averaged out, leaving only exon usage coefficients. Default: No

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool enables visualization of DEXSeq results for individual genes. The input is a DEXSeqResults rds file, which can be output from the DEXSeq tool, and a single gene ID or list of IDs to plot.
.. _DEXSeq: http://master.bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DEXSeq.html
